page.title: 09ECOLOGY OF HAWICK
page.content:
The Hawick area contains several Sites of Scientific Interest.
Hummelknowes Moss is an area of rich fen with a diverse flora including several regionally uncommon species. Associated wet and dry grassland habitats add to the diversity of the site.
From Whitlaw Wood to Hardies Hill is an area of dry and flushed grasslands, associated with an abandoned railway, supporting a particularly diverse flora and invertebrate fauna which include regional and national rarities. The close proximity of native woodland and riverside add to the significance of this site.
Continued Page 10
